qas.question: Who aided Jefferson in designing the Virginia State Capitol?
In what year was the Virginia State Capitol finished?
What was the capital of Virginia circa 1786?
What notable document was authored by Thomas Jefferson in 1786?
In what year could Richmond first be said to have recovered from the destruction of the American Revolution?

context: Richmond recovered quickly from the war, and by <a4_0>1782<a4_0/> was once again a thriving city. In 1786, the <a3_0>Virginia Statute for Religious Freedom<a3_0/> (drafted by Thomas Jefferson) was passed at the temporary capitol in <a2_0>Richmond<a2_0/>, providing the basis for the separation of church and state, a key element in the development of the freedom of religion in the United States. A permanent home for the new government, the Virginia State Capitol building, was designed by Thomas Jefferson with the assistance of <a0_0>Charles-Louis Clérisseau<a0_0/>, and was completed in <a1_0>1788<a1_0/>.
